prompt:
You act as a player of an interactive text adventure game. The goal is to win the game.
The user provides the text of the text adventure, as well as the initial scenario.
The user is not a human and will only prints the output of the game.

Your task is to respond with simple commands, typically one or two words.
name: ChildsPlay.z8

messages.content:
Smothered in Darkness
It is dark and stuffy and you are covered over, something is all draped over you, it is enough to make you crazy.

>

Smothered in Darkness
It is dark and stuffy and you are covered over, something is all draped over you, it is enough to make you crazy.

You are trying not to breathe fast, it is hard when you are so closed in.

>

You can't see any such thing.

>

You can't see any such thing.

>

You can't see any such thing.

>

Everything you try just winds you tighter in the darkness, this sucks.

The darkness is all scratchy on your skin.

>

That's not a verb I recognize.

>

You can't see any such thing.

>

You can't see any such thing.

>

That's not a verb I recognize.

>

What do you want to move?

>

Everything you try just winds you tighter in the darkness, this sucks.

This is oppressive, you are being held down by the man.

>

Suddenly the darkness is gone, and it is so light, you are blinded for just a second. You blink and blink and then you can see the mom holding the blanket she was covering you with. "Oh, kid, I'm so sorry, I thought you were having fun," she says. "We'll do something else."

That'll teach her.

Child's Play
A child, a toy, and a rival by Stephen Granade
Copyright  2007-2008 by Stephen Granade
All rights reserved.
Type ABOUT for more information.
Release 4 / Serial number 080109 / Inform 7 build 5J39 (I6/v6.31 lib 6/11N) 

Middle of the Living Room
This is the middle of the living room, it is all big and vast. But it would be bigger and vaster if there weren't all these pillows and stuff in a big ring around you. The mom is totally all paranoid and whatever, she is a new mom.

There is a red footstool, it looms over you.

The mom is playing with you and is all excited about it.

You can also see a squishy ball, a plush book, and your favorite toy here.

You eye your favorite toy and the mom sees you doing it and scoops it up. "No, no, we're going to try pulling up!" She is all the time trying to build your character or something. She waves the toy at you. "Look! Look where I'm putting it!" She drops the toy on the footstool where you can't see it unless you're all pulled up, that is just no fair.

>

You can't see any such thing.

>

You can crawl around and all but to really get somewhere you have to pick a direction.

>

You can't see any such thing.

>

You can't see any such thing.

>

That's not a verb I recognize.

>

You'll have to say what you want to pull up on.

>

You pull yourself up and it is one hand and another hand which is hard because the footstool is all unstable and rocks some but then you are all on your feet so yay you! And now that you are up here you can see your favorite toy on the footstool.

The mom applauds, "Way to go!" She looks at her watch and is all "Whoops! Playgroup's about to arrive. You hang out here while mom goes and gets ready." She stands up and steps over all of those pillows and you are stuck here now by yourself.

[Your score has just gone up by five points.]

>

That's not a verb I recognize.

>

You cannot reach your favorite toy because you are standing and if you let go with one hand you would just plop down before you could get it.

>

That's not a verb I recognize.

>

Your hands are full of the footstool since you are pulled up on it, but you cannot really take the footstool.

>

You sit down on your diaper and it is good that it is all padded and stuff.

>

You can't see any such thing.

>

Middle of the Living Room
This is the middle of the living room, it is all big and vast. But it would be bigger and vaster if there weren't all these pillows and stuff in a big ring around you.

There is a red footstool, it looms over you.

You can also see a squishy ball and a plush book here.

>

You try that standing thing but you are still no good at it without holding onto something so you will have to pull up on something to stand up.

>

You pull yourself up and it is one hand and another hand which is hard because the footstool is all unstable and rocks some but then you are all on your feet so yay you! And now that you are up here you can see your favorite toy on the footstool.

>

You cannot reach your favorite toy because you are standing and if you let go with one hand you would just plop down before you could get it.

>

You push on the footstool and it rocks and you pull on the footstool and it rocks and then you hear stuff fall off it! But the stuff fell outside the ring of pillows.

[Your score has just gone up by five points.]

>

You sit down on your diaper and it is good that it is all padded and stuff.

>

You can't see any such thing.

>

You can't see any such thing.

>

Middle of the Living Room
This is the middle of the living room, it is all big and vast. But it would be bigger and vaster if there weren't all these pillows and stuff in a big ring around you.

There is a red footstool, it looms over you.

You can also see a squishy ball and a plush book here.

>

You can't see any such thing.

>

They are so soft and way bigger than you, and you have the proportional strength of one baby, so they do not move.

>

You make some noise but it doesn't really do anything for you right now.

>

They are so soft and way bigger than you, and you have the proportional strength of one baby, so they do not move.

>

You pull up on the footstool and get to your feet and you are all steady except for the occasional sway.

>

I only understood you as far as wanting to look.

>

Middle of the Living Room
This is the middle of the living room, it is all big and vast. But it would be bigger and vaster if there weren't all these pillows and stuff in a big ring around you.

There is a red footstool, it is all close to you.

You can also see a squishy ball and a plush book here.

>

I only understood you as far as wanting to look.

>

I only understood you as far as wanting to look.

>

You cannot really push or pull the footstool while you are pulled up on it, that would be a terrible tax on your sense of balance which is nearly nonexistent.

>

You sit down on your diaper and it is good that it is all padded and stuff.

>

I only understood you as far as wanting to throw the squishy ball.

>

Middle of the Living Room
This is the middle of the living room, it is all big and vast. But it would be bigger and vaster if there weren't all these pillows and stuff in a big ring around you.

There is a red footstool, it looms over you.

You can also see a squishy ball and a plush book here.

>

There is no way, you can barely pick stuff up and you are no Cy Young or whatever.

>

You pick it up and it takes two hands.

>

It must be nice to read, the mom and the dad are always doing it, but you do not yet know how.

>

You shove the plush book in your mouth and start chewing on it and that feels good.

>

(popping the plush book out of your mouth first)
Dropped.

>

You pull up on the footstool and get to your feet and you are all steady except for the occasional sway.

>

You cannot really push or pull the footstool while you are pulled up on it, that would be a terrible tax on your sense of balance which is nearly nonexistent.

>

I only understood you as far as wanting to let go.

>

You sit down on your diaper and it is good that it is all padded and stuff.

>

You tug on the footstool and it rocks and rocks and then it stops rocking.

>

You tug on the footstool and it rocks and rocks and then it stops rocking.

>

You tug on the footstool and it rocks and rocks and then it stops rocking.

There is a red footstool, it looms over you.

You can also see a plush book and a squishy ball here.

Middle of the Living Room
This is the middle of the living room, it is all big and vast. But it would be bigger and vaster if there weren't all these pillows and stuff in a big ring around you.

There is a red footstool, it is all close to you.

You can also see a plush book and a squishy ball here.

>

You sit down on your diaper and it is good that it is all padded and stuff.

>
crawl to edge of pillow ring

You can't see any such thing.

>

You can't see any such thing.

>

You can't see any such thing.

Middle of the Living Room
This is the middle of the living room, it is all big and vast. But it would be bigger and vaster if there weren't all these pillows and stuff in a big ring around you.

There is a red footstool, it looms over you.

You can also see a plush book and a squishy ball here.

>

The ring is a bunch of pillows and stuff piled around in a circle so you can't go crawling away when the mom is all distracted. The whole thing is taller than you even when you are sitting. 

Hey wait, what is Alfadog doing wedged in the pillows like that?

>

It is hard enough to move Alfadog around when he is not all covered over with pillows, there is no way you are budging him yourself when he is wedged in there like that.

>

It is hard enough to move Alfadog around when he is not all covered over with pillows, there is no way you are budging him yourself when he is wedged in there like that.

>

You make some noise but it doesn't really do anything for you right now.

>

You can't see any such thing.

>

It is Alfadog, your alphabet-knowing toy and it is all wedged under some pillows. He is about as long as you and he is about as tall as you when you are crawling, it is as if he is your brother only he is a dog. He has this switch on him that makes him run and say the alphabet and such. 

>

That's not a verb I recognize.

>

You pull up on the footstool and get to your feet and you are all steady except for the occasional sway.

>

Middle of the Living Room
This is the middle of the living room, it is all big and vast. But it would be bigger and vaster if there weren't all these pillows and stuff in a big ring around you.

There is a red footstool, it is all close to you.

You can also see a plush book, a squishy ball, and Alfadog here.

>

You have short arms, you can't reach Alfadog from up here.

>

You sit down on your diaper and it is good that it is all padded and stuff.

>

You are all fumbly on the switch but then you get it turned on and look out! Alfadog lights up and his paws start digging in and he is barking out "A! B! C! D! EFG!" It looks like he may be stuck under those pillows but then "L! M! N! O! P!" pillows tumble out of his way and he is free, zipping off to the east! You hear him winding down, "W X Y and Zeee....." And now there is this big gap in the pillows to the east.

That Alfadog is very powerful, he should probably be recalled.

[Your score has just gone up by five points.]

>

In Front of TV
The entertainment center here holds the TV all towering above you and it has these glass doors beneath the TV that you can see stereo equipment through. You are near the couch to the south and the middle of the living room to the west and there is a small open area to play in to the north.

You can see Alfadog and your favorite toy here.

>

You pick it up.

There is a ding-dong and the mom comes clattering in all "Hang on! I'm coming!" She opens the door and there is Marion Kinmundy here for playgroup. She is carrying that little red haired girl Zoe who started coming to playgroup a couple of whiles ago. Zoe sees your favorite toy and her eyes light up.

The mom must be psychic or something because she whirls around and snatches up your favorite toy. "Oh, no," she says with a little laugh, "we're not having you two fight over this thing again. I'll tuck it away where it'll be safe." And Marion laughs too, which is cool, that way they don't notice you and the little red haired girl glaring at each other.

She wants your toy? And the mom wants to lock the toy away? Bring it on.

Chapter 1
Playtime

Right behind Marion and Zoe the little red haired girl is Lisa who is Cassie's mom. Lisa is carrying Cassie all carefully but Cassie is squirming to get down. "Hi Farina, hi Marion--hang on Cassie, mommy's going to put you down," Lisa says and then she steps over the baby gate and dumps Cassie by the couch to the south of you.

Meanwhile the mom is putting all the pillows back on the couch and loveseat. As she finishes she asks Marion, "Can I put this toy in Zoe's backpack for now?" Marion is all "Sure!" as she puts Zoe on the floor over by the rocking chair and sits on the loveseat.

[Your score has just gone up by ten points.]

>

You can't see any such thing.

>

In Front of TV
The entertainment center here holds the TV all towering above you and it has these glass doors beneath the TV that you can see stereo equipment through. You are near the couch to the south and the middle of the living room to the west and there is a small open area to play in to the north.

You can see Alfadog here.

>

Small Open Area
You are east of the gliding rocking chair that is fun to ride on and north of the big TV that Sesame Street comes from. On the wall is a big bookcase full of chewy books. There is a way into the kitchen to the north but one of those baby gates is there, that is no fair.

Part of your playpen is here, there is more of it to the southwest.

There is a ding-dong! and the mom goes and opens the front door. It is Becca and her son Jemison and some strange guy is there holding Watson Mason. "Come on in, everyone," the mom says. She turns to the strange guy, "I'm glad you could make it, Parry."

Parry shrugs and smiles and says, "I always wondered what everyone did during playgroup."

"Drink mimosas!" Becca says over her shoulder to Parry and there is polite laughter and Parry smiles like he is kinda unsure about all of this.

"Why don't you put Watson in here with the others?" the mom asks and Parry nods. He ends up putting Watson by Jemison over by the loveseat. Then all the standing adults sit down so now I guess they are sitting adults.

>

You can't see any such thing.

>

In Front of TV
The entertainment center here holds the TV all towering above you and it has these glass doors beneath the TV that you can see stereo equipment through. You are near the couch to the south and the middle of the living room to the west and there is a small open area to play in to the north.

You can see Alfadog here.

>

Couch at the East
You are where the couch ends here at the east, at least where it ends at one end. North is the TV and west is more couch.

Cassie is all pulled up on the east grey couch. 

Cassie cruises hand over hand along the east grey couch to the west and is gone.

>
